_source.age_criteria:
Minimum age: 18.0 Years
Maximum age: 999.0 Years
_source.description: This phase II clinical trial studies how well bortezomib, rituximab, fludarabine phosphate, mitoxantrone hydrochloride, and dexamethasone work in treating patients with relapsed or refractory follicular lymphoma. Bortezomib may stop the growth of cancer cells by blocking some of the enzymes needed for cell growth. Monoclonal antibodies, such as rituximab, can block cancer growth in different ways. Some block the ability of cancer to grow and spread. Others find cancer cells and help kill them or carry cancer-killing substances to them. Drugs used in chemotherapy, such as fludarabine phosphate, mitoxantrone hydrochloride and dexamethasone, work in different ways to stop the growth of cancer cells, either by killing the cells or by stopping them from dividing. Giving bortezomib with rituximab, fludarabine phosphate, mitoxantrone hydrochloride, and dexamethasone may be an effective treatment for follicular lymphoma.

eligibility_criteria.description: Absolute neutrophil count of < 1000 within 14 days before enrollment unless documented by the treating physician to be due to disease
Platelet count of < 50,000 within 14 days before enrollment unless documented by the treating physician to be due to the disease
Patients with known human immunodeficiency virus positive (HIV+) status; (patients may start therapy while awaiting result of test and be withdrawn from protocol therapy if the test returns positive)
Serious medical or psychiatric illness likely to interfere with participation in this clinical study
Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status 0-2
Male subject agrees to use an acceptable method for contraception for the duration of the study therapy
Total bilirubin < 3 times the upper limit of normal unless documented by the treating physician to be secondary to underlying lymphoma
Patient has received other investigational drugs for this disease within 14 days of enrollment
Cardiac ejection fraction less than 35% at study entry measured by echocardiogram, multi gated acquisition scan (MUGA) or cardiac magnetic resonance imaging (MRI)
Estimated or measured creatinine clearance of less than 30 ml/min
Aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alanine aminotransferase (ALT) < 3 times upper limit of normal unless documented by the treating physician to be secondary to underlying lymphoma
Patient must have a diagnosis of grade1-3 follicular lymphoma with persistent, relapsed, or refractory disease to at least one prior regimen

Myocardial infarction within 6 months prior to enrollment or has New York Hospital Association (NYHA) class III or IV heart failure, uncontrolled angina, severe uncontrolled ventricular arrhythmias, or electrocardiographic evidence of acute ischemia
Patient has hypersensitivity to boron, mannitol or any drug included in the current protocol

Female subject is pregnant or lactating; confirmation that the subject is not pregnant must be established by a negative serum beta (B)-human chorionic gonadotropin (B-hCG) pregnancy test result within 2 weeks of enrollment; pregnancy testing is not required for post-menopausal or surgically sterilized women

Voluntary written informed consent before performance of any study-related procedure not part of normal medical care, with the understanding that consent may be withdrawn by the subject at any time; female subject is either post-menopausal or surgically sterilized or willing to use an acceptable method of birth control (i.e., a hormonal contraceptive, intra-uterine device, diaphragm with spermicide, condom with spermicide, or abstinence) for the duration of the study therapy

groups.description: Patients receive bortezomib IV on days 1 and 8, fludarabine phosphate IV over 30 minutes on days 1-3, rituximab IV on day 1, dexamethasone PO on days 1-5, and mitoxantrone hydrochloride IV over 30 minutes on day 2. Treatment repeats every 28 days for up to 8 courses in the absence of disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.

outcome_measures.measure: Incidence of adverse events as graded by the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 3.0

outcome_measures.analysis_method: PFS will be described with Kaplan-Meier analyses.
outcome_measures.time_frame: Number of days between on study and the date of progression or death, whichever comes first, assessed up to 36 months

outcome_measures.analysis_method: EFS will be described with Kaplan-Meier analyses.
outcome_measures.time_frame: Number of days between time of response or stable disease and the date of relapse or death, whichever comes first, assessed up to 36 months

_source.public_title: Bortezomib, Rituximab, Fludarabine Phosphate, Mitoxantrone Hydrochloride, and Dexamethasone in Treating Patients With Relapsed or Refractory Follicular Lymphoma
_source.scientific_description:
PRIMARY OBJECTIVES:
I. Evaluate the efficacy overall response rate (ORR) of combining bortezomib with rituximab, fludarabine (fludarabine phosphate), mitoxantrone (mitoxantrone hydrochloride), and dexamethasone in treating patients with follicular cell lymphoma.

SECONDARY OBJECTIVES:
I. Evaluate the safety of this regimen in patients with follicular lymphoma.
II. Evaluate the time to disease progression in patients treated on this regimen.
III. Evaluate progression free survival of patients treated on this regimen.
IV. Evaluate overall survival of patients treated with this regimen.

OUTLINE:
Patients receive bortezomib intravenously (IV) on days 1 and 8, fludarabine phosphate IV over 30 minutes on days 1-3, rituximab IV on day 1, dexamethasone orally (PO) on days 1-5, and mitoxantrone hydrochloride IV over 30 minutes on day 2. Treatment repeats every 28 days for up to 8 courses in the absence of disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.

After completion of study treatment, patients are followed up at 3, 6, 9, 12, 18, 24, and 36 months.

comments: Changed date from 07/15/2008 per Center feedback for CTRP data clean-up EW# 43492.

_source.title: A Phase Two Study of Bortezomib in Combination with Rituximab, Fludarabine, Mitoxantrone, and Dexamethasone (VR-FND) for Relapsed or Refractory Follicular Lymphoma
